channel.title: Need help port forwarding
channel.description: My server has been port forwarding and running for two weeks and now the ip wont work, i've tried to change it and that didnt work... fucking help me

item.title: Need help port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @why_so_serious why so serious
item.description:
@why_so_serious wrote:

http://www.runecode.smffy.com/index.php?topic=2.0
that should help sir.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:14, topic:378240”][quote author=brandonscarinfo link=topic=474118.msg3467700#msg3467700 date=1295057392]

[quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=474118.msg3467674#msg3467674 date=1295055930]

[quote author=brandonscarinfo link=topic=474118.msg3467663#msg3467663 date=1295055429]

if you are using a no-ip makesure the no-ip ip address on file didn’t change ;o thats what happened to me
[/quote]Is that not the point of No-IP’s Dynamic Update Client? :S

well the DUC didn’t fix it for me…
and i mean literally going to no-ip.com and checking that the ip didnt get changed.
[/quote]Set your hosting machine up with a static IP address, then the DUC will be redundant.

I don’t need to… I have a VPS. and even with a VPS it still failed…nothings 100% perfect dude. Don’t take everything so literal. Especially NoIpDUC. Very unreliable.
[/quote]You’re using No-IP with a hired VPS? I’d pay the $10 for a domain. Also even VPSs need static IP addresses.[/quote]

Please stop while you still can. It’s apparent to me I am arguing with someone that thinks they know everything. Just let this topic die. When No-Ip screws up for you, you will then see what I am talking about.

Read full topic

@ilegalpvp wrote:

EX: 192.168..

item.title: Need help port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

If it just stopped then something obviously changed, I’m guessing your IP address. May I ask, is your computer you’re hosting the server on configured to request a static IP from your wireless router? Assuming that is your networking setup. Also perhaps you recently installed some security software that is ‘firewalling’ your RSPS’s server on its designated port. If your IP address has changed you may need to change your port-forwarding settings in either your modem or router, as I know that with my router, you have to set the IP address to forward the desired port.

Read full topic
